tool.name: DeleteOrphanedTypes
tool.summary:
This tool searches the database for certain kinds of items that are not used by anything else in the database. It can either be used in "find only" or "find and delete" mode.

Please be aware that any custom code (for example, a custom step that sets a job's priority to "High") or anything that exists outside of the Workflow Manager database will most likely NOT be accounted for by this tool. You may still wish to use the "Preview" functionality, but you should manually delete the types of items used by these tools.
tool.usage:
• The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

  • The user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_bool_previewChangesOnly
param.displayname: Preview changes (do not actually delete any step types)
param.dialogReference:
If this option is enabled, the unused items that are found will not actually be removed from the database, but only reported in the output messages.

NOTE: If multiple sets of orphaned items are selected, previewing changes may not identify all items that will be deleted if this flag is disabled. There may be certain items that are only referred to by other unused items, and so are not detected initially.

When scripting, the options are:

  • PREVIEW_DELETES / true - Reports the orphaned items only; does not delete any items from the database.

  • PERFORM_DELETES / false - Removes any identified orphaned items from the database.
param.pythonReference:
If this option is enabled, the unused items that are found will not actually be removed from the database, but only reported in the output messages.

NOTE: If multiple sets of orphaned items are selected, previewing changes may not identify all items that will be deleted if this flag is disabled. There may be certain items that are only referred to by other unused items, and so are not detected initially.

When scripting, the options are:

  • PREVIEW_DELETES / true - Reports the orphaned items only; does not delete any items from the database.

  • PERFORM_DELETES / false - Removes any identified orphaned items from the database.

param.name: in_mvString_checklist
param.displayname: List of orphaned types for which to check
param.dialogReference:
Allows the user to specify which type(s) of orphaned objects should be searched for in the database. The options are:

  • CLEAN_WORKFLOWS - Checks for/deletes workflows that are not in use by any job type.

  • CLEAN_STEP_TYPES - Checks for/deletes step types that are not in use by any workflow.

  • CLEAN_STATUS_TYPES - Checks for/deletes status types that are not in use by any job or workflow step. Note that the core Workflow Manager status types (ex. "Closed", "Created", "Ready to Work", etc.) are excluded from this check.

  • CLEAN_PRIORITIES - Checks for/deletes priority levels that are not in use by any job or job type default setting.

  • CLEAN_TA_WORKBOOKS - Checks for/deletes Task Assistant workbooks that are not referenced by any "LaunchArcMap" step.

  • CLEAN_USERS - Checks for/deletes users who are not members of any group, do not have any jobs assigned to them, and are not part of any default step type or job type assignment.

  • CLEAN_MAP_DOCS - Checks for/deletes map documents that are not used by any job type or map view option, and are not referenced by any "LaunchArcMap" step.
param.pythonReference:
Allows the user to specify which type(s) of orphaned objects should be searched for in the database. The options are:

  • CLEAN_WORKFLOWS - Checks for/deletes workflows that are not in use by any job type.

  • CLEAN_STEP_TYPES - Checks for/deletes step types that are not in use by any workflow.

  • CLEAN_STATUS_TYPES - Checks for/deletes status types that are not in use by any job or workflow step. Note that the core Workflow Manager status types (ex. "Closed", "Created", "Ready to Work", etc.) are excluded from this check.

  • CLEAN_PRIORITIES - Checks for/deletes priority levels that are not in use by any job or job type default setting.

  • CLEAN_TA_WORKBOOKS - Checks for/deletes Task Assistant workbooks that are not referenced by any "LaunchArcMap" step.

  • CLEAN_USERS - Checks for/deletes users who are not members of any group, do not have any jobs assigned to them, and are not part of any default step type or job type assignment.

  • CLEAN_MAP_DOCS - Checks for/deletes map documents that are not used by any job type or map view option, and are not referenced by any "LaunchArcMap" step.

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool searches the database for certain kinds of items that are not used by anything else in the database. It can either be used in "find only" or "find and delete" mode.

Please be aware that any custom code (for example, a custom step that sets a job's priority to "High") or anything that exists outside of the Workflow Manager database will most likely NOT be accounted for by this tool. You may still wish to use the "Preview" functionality, but you should manually delete the types of items used by these tools.
